Slava Imeshev wrote:

>  > Hi All,
>  > I am using JUnit for regression testing. One of my test case
> methods executes same testconditions with a list of input data. When one
> of my test case condition fails, JUnit reports failure and aborts from
> further executing the other test data.
>  >
>  > While it reports the failure, I would love it to execute the other
> tests also in the test method and report their results. Is there a way
> to make JUnit it to report alone and ignore the failures to continue
> testing.
> 
> You could use junit ant task properties haltonfailure="off" and
> haltonerror="off". Example:
> 
> <junit fork="yes" printsummary="on" haltonfailure="off"
> haltonerror="off" errorproperty="test.errors"
> failureproperty="test.errors">
> ...
> </junit>

I am not an Ant expert, but I don't believe that will work. It allows a 
test suite to continue executing if a test fails, but each test will 
still stop executing after the first assertion failure.
